paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the KCNH2 gene variant G816V, including penetrance data and functional studies.

patients.phenotype: intermediate Long-QT2 phenotype, sudden cardiac death

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Here we report and characterize a novel pathologic missense mutation, G816V HERG, in a patient with sudden cardiac death.
This intermediate severity defect agrees with the mild clinical presentation in other family members harboring the same mutation.

functional_data.summary: The G816V HERG mutation causes a trafficking defect and acts in a partially dominant-negative manner.
assays: heterologous expression in mammalian cell culture

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in family members.
variants.additional_notes: The study suggests a potential role for hypokalemia in the patient's lethal arrhythmia.
key_quotes: The mutant G816V HERG channel has reduced protein expression and shows a trafficking defective phenotype.
Possible hypokalemia in the proband induced WT HERG degradation combined with haplo-insufficiency may have further compromised repolarization reserve.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the KCNH2 variant G816V was successfully extracted.
